result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dominik Osmon in court.  Attorney Scott H Lyon in court for Dominik Osmon. Information received. Defendant waives reading and enters NOT GUILTY pleas to all counts. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond cont'd.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dominik Osmon in court.  Attorney Scott H Lyon in court for Dominik Osmon. Court makes stmt. PQW received/reviewed by the Court w/ defendant. Court finds the waiver to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts the waiver. Court further finds probable cause a felony has been committed and the defendant is bound over to the circuit court. Defendant ordered to appear at the next hrg. Present bond cont'd. 2:05 pm Back on the record. Atty Lyon requests the due date for the Dean payment be amended to the 15th of each month. Atty Lyon will file an Amended Order Appointing Counsel w/ the requested change included.
Arraignment scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
